content.question: The function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals ln open parentheses x plus 1 half close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced></math>. An equation in two variables is given by <math alttext="square root of x plus square root of y equals 1"><msqrt><mi>x</mi></msqrt><mo>+</mo><msqrt><mi>y</mi></msqrt><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>. In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, what are the coordinates of the point of intersection of the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> and the graph that satisfies the equation in two variables?

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
